utterances.utterance: He establishes a point that creates disruption that brings people closer to his opinion. He is for data, he just decided to say, "We aren't tired for you not paying." And he brought them to the table. He is a salesman! A salesman poses the question.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Why is he saying everybody, put your money in the tail, okay, so that we can combine resources to make everyone should pay their fair share if he wasn't adhering to the principle of article five?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Meanwhile, back at the ranch, I would love to hear him say that, but beyond that I think this president cannot go around being our version of the mean girls and says, this country is in, this country is out. What he's got to do is he's got to complete --

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: What do you think happened with bringing over 50 Arab leaders together and re-engaging with Saudi Arabia?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Yes. None of them were Sunnis.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: He didn't even visit President Obama last time he visited.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They are Sunnis. All right. Greg, let me get to, Greg. Ariana Grande released a statement and she said now, compassion, kindness, love, strength and oneness that you've showed one another in the past week is the exact opposite of the heinous intentions it must take to pull up something as evil as what happened on Monday. And now she's throwing a benefit concert for those people that lost loved ones.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, you know, it's interesting. She's -- I say hurray for maturity.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Because we remember a couple of years ago about the incident in the doughnut shop --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She said I hate Americans because she was referring to obesity, because of the donut that apparently might have spin on that. She seems to have matured. But the message that she is giving is designed to hit all the right notes without offense. So, it's honest, but it's a very, very, very careful.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It stays within the lines of being an entertainment world draws. You can't mention the cause. What caused this? Because if you do, you step outside the lines. What's the space you're making? Are you in trouble--

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: You are making up arbitrary lines up, Greg!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what I'm saying.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: No, I don't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: An entertainer cannot actually attribute the cause of the attack.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: If you want to say radical Islam --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It wouldn't be such a bad idea, but I'm not expecting it from her.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Are you saying that she didn't write the statement herself? Is that what you're saying?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I am saying, it was a perfectly made statement that hits all the right notes without offense.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It involves a lot of love, did you notice?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I think she meant it, though.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Of course. She's on the Disney Channel.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's what they do there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What did you think about that statement? Do you think she was to safe? Do you think she could have gone a little further and really putting a name on the enemy?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. I think she was like a country music -- it would have been a little bit more.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Guys, wait, wait, wait. You guys, you've got to be clear. She is devastated by this.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: We know that. Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She's walking a fine line.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Yes. I think Greg is absolutely right. Look, she's 23 years old, can you imagine putting on a concert and having something like this happen in the name of evil, in the name of hatred? I mean, I cannot imagine what she's gone through. Obviously with the family --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I thought should be out longer to be honest.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I mean, real genuine grief and --

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: And this is what we should do in response to terror because that is what they want. They want us to cower to them, they want us to cower hate, and she's saying, no. She's putting on this concert. So, you know what? Good for her. Kudos to Ariana Grande. I think that this is --

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: This is going to be two points for Lisa Boothe because I agree with you again!

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I feel like I should be worried that Richard is agreeing with me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's not a good thing.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: This never happens, and I don't think this is a good thing. I'm in a little worried.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Here's the thing. Politics aside, first of all, this happened in your contract which has to be nerve-racking. Right? But not only has she put on her statement, she's paying for the funerals, but she is having another benefit concert. She is a class act. Ariana Grande? Class act.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. And also --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The better point, too is that, this is a group of people, Islamic terrorists, who are striking out against fun and leisure activities. And these are the entertainment world, these are their fans. So, they should be very interested in fighting back and saying the right things and standing up to this because they are the targets now. It's not just, you know, buildings in New York City anymore. You know? It's not just subways. They are looking at, you know, Bataclan was a concert.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Soft targets.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Soft targets. But they're usually concerts. The club in Orlando? These are where young people go.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Football stadium as well, we've seen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. But I think entertainers and celebrities should be more outspoken because they are going after your fans.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Exactly. Next, Hillary Clinton is not over her loss to President Trump. We will show you what you told graduates next.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Hillary Clinton is back at it today, giving a highly charged and sometimes bitter commencement speech at her Alma Mater Wesley College. And she didn't sound too happy with the Trump administration.

utterances.speaker: CLINTON
utterances.utterance: There is a full-fledged assault on truth and reason. When people in power invent their own facts, and attack those who question them, it can mark the beginning of the end of a free society. That is not hyperbole. It is what authoritarian regimes throughout history have done.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And that is a warning. But one thing she didn't warn the grads about was wild speculation while remembering her time in college.

utterances.speaker: CLINTON
utterances.utterance: We were furious about the past presidential elections of a man whose presidency would eventually end in disgrace with his impeachment for obstruction of justice.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Hmm. Well, she was referring there to Richard Nixon. But let's have a quick fact-check, shall we? President Nixon resigned and was never actually impeached, unlike Ms. Clinton's husband who was the most recent president to be impeached. Feast on that fact, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I remember when I was a kid in the backyard, we had these dandelion greens. I don't know if you remember it. But you can suck on them and they were --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: A feast.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. You don't need them anymore because Hillary is just a walking fountain of bitterness. And I'm starting now to feel sorry for her. Imagine being the quarterback of a losing Super Bowl team that spent months trashing the winning quarterback? Is the textbook definition of a loser? And think about how heroic it could have been if she had done a commencement speech about losing gracefully, about giving the winter a chance before condemning that person. And you can also apologize to Monica Lewinsky for shaming her.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: How about that? Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Why don't you do that, Hillary? In between cost --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Are you sorry, Hillary?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She can't hear you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Hearing no response. Lisa Boothe.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I think she needs to spend more time in the woods, because clearly she hasn't moved past the election. She hasn't moved past losing. And I find it to be hilarious that she talked about an assault on the truth, coming from someone who systematically lied to Americans throughout the general election. Look, she's clearly better. She was supposed to beat Barack Obama. And the Democratic primary going back in 2008. She didn't, she was supposed to be Donald Trump. She didn't. So, she really is just a little bit better here. And look, the reality is needs to accept the fact, the reason she lost is because she ran a horrible campaign that is stepping foot in Wisconsin. She sent more money pursuing one Congressional district, one Electoral College vote that she did in Wisconsin and Michigan combined in the final weeks which had brought her 26 Electoral College votes. So, I think she needs some more self-reflection in the woods, in a tranquil place, and maybe give it to more thoughts before she comes back up.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. Let's go to my man Jesse Watters who spent some time in those woods and unable to find her.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Unable to find her! She's very tricky in the woods. Can we talk about the hat for a second? What was going on with the hat? That's not a -- she's not wearing it properly. She looks French to me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's what she is supposed to wear, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Is that how you're supposed to wear?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I've never seen it worn like that. I don't know. Maybe that's just --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I think she could have like tilted it back a little in the show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's what you focus on and her hat?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, listen, I'm very superficial, Greg. You know that. Listen, in her concession speech right after the election, she said, I believe in America, Donald Trump is going to be our president. We owe him an open mind and the good will to lead. Since then, she's blame Russia, misogyny, Bernie, and fake news. And every time she opens her mouth, I think the American public says, "Thank God she's not our president." And the fact that she raises up impeachment is kind of ironic since her husband was impeached for perjury. And then she made fun of Trump saying that he likes to talk about crowd size. Last time I checked, she couldn't fill a high school gymnasium. She also said that Donald Trump is assaulting the truth. Hillary lied about her secret server, she lied about Benghazi being about a video, she worked for a president who lied about keeping her health care. So, she doesn't really have any leg to stand on. I think when she needs to do is just go quietly and so other Democrats can come to the table and be the real leaders of the Democratic Party.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Right. So, no leg to stand on. So, she needs a lounge chair in the woods, to perhaps ask her, so she doesn't look too French.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I have two points. Let me make a broader point.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Which one is right?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: They're both right. Now, the first point I will make is there's been a lot of politicians who gave in political speeches this cycle, and they all sucked, right? Because they were all smug. Donald Trump spent more time in the coast guard speech that are honoring the graduates talking about himself and the fake news media. She spent more time in her speech talking about why she lost. She spent more time in her speech pushing a political agenda.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She got heckled.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: These graduations are about the graduates and their families. Point blank, period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: They're not about political agenda. No, every person who spoke this cycle was awful.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Including that?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: They're all guilty.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes!

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You made a great point. Let it go.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: And the second point is, I have advice for Democrats. All we've got to do here is sit in on our hands and watched Donald Trump self-destruct. It's been 130 some odd days, his highest approval rating that's ever been is 41 percent.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Fake news.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Number one. Number two.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Higher than the media.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Very true. Higher than the media.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Higher than you right now.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Right. Number two, he has a health care bill that is going to fail because the Senate is not going to pass it. Right? He has four Russian investigations all happening at the same time. All we've got to do is sit back and watch the slow car wreck happened. Democrats, don't say anything. Don't jab at him, just watch. It will slowly crash into the car and implode. Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So you are rooting for the destruction of our country.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: No, I think that this guy, no! I think that this guy cannot lead the country. And he is showing it. One hundred and thirty some odd days in, and it's obvious. Sixty percent some odd percent of Americans agree with me.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, they need the extra time, they need President Trump in office as long as possible because they still can't figure out anybody to lead their party or to run against him. So, they needed more time --

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I don't know about that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes. All right. Boomerang to myself. Directly ahead, an outrageous situation at a college in Washington. A professor threatened because he objected to an event that kicks white people off campus for a day. That story after the break.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. At Evergreen State College, a group of students alleging rampant racism held, quote, "A day of absence where white people were strongly encouraged to stay away from campus." Biology Professor Bret Weinstein objected to the idea and the students did not react well.

utterances.speaker: BRET WEINSTEIN, EVERGREEN STATE COLLEGE PROFESSOR
utterances.utterance: I am not interested in debate. I'm interested only in dialectic, which does mean I listen to you and you listen to me.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: You don't care. You want to speak on -- this not about you. We are not speaking on --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: It's all about him!

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: We aren't speaking on terms of white privilege. You have lost that one.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: This is not about you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: You said some racist (bleep).

utterances.speaker: WEINSTEIN
utterances.utterance: I did not.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: And now you apologize.

utterances.speaker: WEINSTEIN
utterances.utterance: I did not. History could pivot in the direction of the values that you are standing here for.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes, resign!

utterances.speaker: WEINSTEIN
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Resign.

utterances.speaker: WEINSTEIN
utterances.utterance: I'm not resigning.

utterances.speaker: STUDENTS
utterances.utterance: Hey, hey! Ho, ho! Bret Weinstein has got to go!

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Terrible.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Terrible. Professor Weinstein now says the police are telling him that he is not safe on campus. Demonstrations at the college have only intensified this week.

utterances.speaker: STUDENTS
utterances.utterance: Hey, hey! Ho, ho! These racist teachers have got to go! Hey, hey! Ho, ho! These racist teachers have got to go!

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: That protest occurred on Wednesday in the library and according to the school, no one was hurt and nothing was damaged. Greg, what do you make of this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: These are fascist robots with no brains in their heads. They should never be hired for a job. Fascism and racism are now the double major at this university. It's like those horror movies where you find out that the phone call is coming from inside the house? The campus was supposed to be about free debate, but now it's the siege of totalitarianism. Do you know what this professor did that upset them? He came out against a racist act. There was a day where they say white people, don't come. They changed it so that white people can come, and blacks could go. That's racist! He was calling it out. And this is what happens in a sterile environment free of libertarians and conservatives and it's all liberals, they eat their own? Do not hire these kids! Do not let them get into the real world. Let them get jobs in the faculty, let them destroy themselves, they do not deserve your time and effort! They are disgusting! Crap!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They're here!

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Good point.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Should we end this --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And you can't disagree -- this is horrible!

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Yes. I know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is absolutely horrible!

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Well, and so, Richard, to that, what does this accomplish?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: So, this story is a little more complex than --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What, did I --

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: No! Listen, I said quite a bit of time --

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: But Richard, the students often hide and barricaded --

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: So, wait a minute.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: So this day of absence is a thing that universities have done for years.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: And they changed --

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: No, no, no.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: They changed it this year.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I will tell you. What happened was, there was an API student who was arrested at a party and no other student was arrested. So, because of that, the university president created a board of students and faculty and parents to sort of -- they created a board to sort of figure out how to deal with some of these proposals. One of these board proposals is to change how the hiring, how they hire professors. That's what teed off this guy. And so he sent an open email to the entire campus about the hiring of professors. And students felt that that email...

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: His email was in response to the fact that they have always had this day but the difference is...

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: No, no, no. The email was in response to the changing of the hiring.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: ... this year, they asked for white people to leave...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I read the email.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: There were multiple emails sent out by this professor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The one they were ticked off about was about the one reacting to the students being intimidated...

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: But this is not his first act. He also, there is an interview on You Tube, where he talks about...

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: But, Richard, can you -- the problem is...

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: This is liberal arts college. Evergreen College, for God's sake.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: And this teacher also is a liberal, a liberal professor

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's also a liberal professor, and he's being eaten alive.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: He's being alive because...

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: What has this accomplished, Richard? If you cannot have dialogue, if they are shutting down these teachers, if they are not allowing for discourse...

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Here's the thing. All the students on this campus besides a couple agree with where the other student body is. I'm not saying I agree with this protest at all.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: They're (inaudible) library?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: But I think this university had larger problems on its hand than just this professor.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: No! There is a systemic racism at this university. That's why this API student (ph) was the only...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't trust it's systemic. When you say systemic, you better have the evidence.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: But there is also systemic discrimination at this university.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Explain in detail. Systemic means a lot.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Yes, they have problems with how they deal with sexual assaults on this campus. They also have problems in this campus on how to deal with trans students.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Talking points to me from...

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Talking points from where?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know. That's a good question, from where?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Kimberly, what does this accomplish?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Nothing except -- Exactly. The problem is, you have a professor like this who -- they are not listening. They are not being bright about or being reasonable. Now they are persecuting this guy and threatening like he was just on with Tucker (ph), so our audience has seen him and heard his story, it's terrific and it is an ongoing story, in terms of these students taking over basically this campus. So the problem is we have now rising intolerance and we have suppression of free speech which has now risen to the level where you are interfering with education and schools actually being able to run and operate and actually educate. That's the problem. And in the issue of personal safety. Can you imagine this professor?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Jesse, this teacher said that the police told him that he cannot come to school because his life is apparently -- it's threatened.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, Apparently after shouting at the professor, the protesters marched out of the building and were met by campus police. The students fearful for their lives began retreating toward the library and ultimately ended up in the trans and clear center unity lounge, fearful for their lives. Campus safety in my school told me to pour out the beer and go back to my dorm.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Somehow, that doesn't surprise me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If I don't have to go to class one day, I support that. I want to get behind that. I get a day off. I've been working really hard. Don't fight racism with more racism, Richard. When I was in school, I didn't barricade myself in the library. I tried to get out of the library as soon as possible.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And out of class.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Not surprising. All right, guys, we've got to go. We'll continue this discussion during the break. So fun. The Justice Department is going to challenge an appeal's court ruling against President Trump's travel ban. Is the Supreme Court next? Details coming ahead.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: President Trump's travel ban is going to the Supreme Court. Yes, indeed, America, it is true. Attorney General Jeff Sessions says he's taking the president's executive order to the nation's highest court after another federal court struck it down. Former acting attorney general, Sally Yates, told graduating Harvard law students why she declined to defend the ban before President Trump fired her.

utterances.speaker: SALLY YATES, FORMER ACTING ATTORNEY GENERAL
utterances.utterance: Defending the constitutionality of the travel ban would require the Department of Justice to argue that the executive order has nothing to do with religion, despite the numerous prior statements that have been made by the president and his surrogates regarding his intent to effectuate a Muslim ban. I direct the Department of Justice not to defend the ban.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Hashtag, I agree with Sally Yates and all the federal judges that struck it down which is pretty much all of them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Did you just say hashtag?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I did say hashtag.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What is this...

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Greg, I'm going to you first.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's just another -- prior comments, statements don't matter. This is another example of how discriminating good from evil will allow people to die. Look, Trump made a mistake in the sense that they shouldn't call it a travel ban, they shouldn't call it a terror ban, or call it "operation haystack," which the whole idea of finding the needles or destroying the needles or make sure the needles don't get in. The fact is, no, we are hamstrung by a mentality that says, because we are bad, we can't chase the bad out, because at a heart, we are a flawed nation. And it really is putting us in a straitjacket. Listen. It is nuts! All we are trying to do is protect our people. And that is somehow bigoted. How can you bigoted -- how can you be racist against a set of ideas? Religion is a set of ideas. That's all it is.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Trump is a walking contradiction, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Sorry. I'm losing my mind here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Pull your collar off, you're going to feel much better.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Because In 20 minutes, I'm on vacation, okay?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He got the short sleeves on for flapping his wings...

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Clearly, he tried to fly. But, what I will say is this, and I will make it pretty quick. You've got to let them fly. What I will say is this. They are pretty quick. He says that he needs the Muslim world to work with him. You cannot ban half of them and say work with me at the same time. Lisa?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He did.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: That's why the court struck it down.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Clearly, the leaders that he met with wanted to meet with him in Saudi Arabia and these other countries. Jordan has had a lot of positive things to say about this administration. Look, this entire conversation has been completely overblown. We are talking about a brief pause from countries that have either been identified as state sponsors of terrorism, state harbors of terrorism. Attorney General Sessions has identified 300 refugees in this country that are involved in some sort of FBI, terrorist-related investigations. We know that it's very difficult to vet individuals coming from war-torn places like Syria. John Brennan himself, the former CIA director, said that ISIS was trying to infiltrate the west through migrants and through Syrian refugees. Further, there are articles about ISIS being able to print documents by taking over government buildings in Syria and being able to print Syrian passports. So why, with all this information collectively that we know, would we not want to be careful about who we are letting in to this country?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: You say, short pause, I say Muslim ban. Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I say the Supreme Court is going to uphold the constitutionality and Richard is going to cry his out.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Negative.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: U.S. code 1182. Whenever the president finds that the entry of any aliens or any class of aliens in the United States will be detrimental to the interests of the United States, he may by proclamation, and for such period as he shall deem necessary, suspend the entry of all aliens or any class of aliens as immigrants or nonimmigrants, or impose on the entry of aliens any restrictions he may deem to be appropriate.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's executive branch...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That is a firm, legal account. What he is doing is junk shopping and filtering it up to the Ninth Circuit...

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: It is more than the Ninth Circuit. It's more than the Ninth Circuit. And appeals court.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: ... Circuit on ideological grounds. It was on ideological grounds.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: You can say what you want to say. Here is the thing. This travel ban is against the First Amendment.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Go to a lawyer.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You might want to ask a lawyer.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I'm going to the lawyer!

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Go to someone who knows about this. Bottom line is, the U.S. Supreme Court is going to strike down the Fourth Circuit and the Ninth Circuit because we are witnessing in this country a huge power grab of the executive branch and the authority of the president. That is a huge problem because they are trying to legislate from the bench and do the forum shopping which is not going to stand whatsoever. They are about to get a big legal banking.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I think the thinking is going to go the other way.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You want to place a wager?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: However you want it, it's coming.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wait, spanking?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Did someone say spanking?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: (inaudible) will not happen.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Not you. You hate your quota (ph).

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Burglar thinking.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Stay right there. "Facebook Friday" is up next!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's "Facebook Friday." My favorite time of the year. All right, the first one will start with -- will go around the table with Kimberly. This is from Susan F. How will you be spending the Memorial Day weekend?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, are you asking or is Susan asking?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I just want to know if you are not going to be in your apartment.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Creepy. So, I'm going to be in the Hamptons.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh! You aren't a stereotype.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, you got me very...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Richard?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I'm going back to the nation's capital to hang out with some friends.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What is the nation's capital?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Washington, D.C. Have you heard of that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, no, never.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He thought it was New York.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Jesse, plans?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Some community service?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Soup kitchens.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Work furlough.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. That will never happen. We know Jesse. Jesse, you're going to the Hamptons?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, I'm not. I'm not going to the Hamptons.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He has a pre-planned vacation.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I have the receipts to prove it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Lisa?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: It's supposed to be raining this weekend. So, I'm heading back to D.C. tomorrow. I think I'm going to a cookout on Saturday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A bunch of beltway insiders here. I am actually going to Miami. I am not a big fan of Miami, so I will spend a lot of time in the hotel room.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You do not seem like a Miami guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, no, no. I have my vices, but not in Miami.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think that was fun. That was pretty funny.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was terrible.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Anna Marie -- Lisa, pay attention.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Do not get sucked into Watters world!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If someone narrated your life, who would you want to narrator to be?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Don't look at me. Sorry, you got stuck with that. Oh, my gosh, I'm blanking on his voice. It's a male voice. A male's voice, would that be weird?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Lou Dobbs?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Lou Dobbs is like Fox News' Lou Rawls.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: You'll never find another love.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: You know, there is some commercial on the air now. I think it plays on Fox. It's like an Australian chick? (inaudible). I want her. I don't know who she is, but...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Someone will write you on Twitter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What about you, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm going to go with James Earl Jones. No-brainer.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He's not an Australian girl.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: My mind is blown!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I self identify as an Australian girl.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's what I thought you were referring to.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: That's what I was originally thinking.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Richard?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I have two. But either Oprah Winfrey or Morgan Freeman.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So those are too obvious. Everybody wants Morgan Freeman.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I said Oprah first.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would like Morgan Fairchild.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is that her name?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't know who that is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Falcon Crest.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank you very much, Kimberly. Fairchild. I bet she watches "The Five."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Do you know what? I'm really liking Bono these days.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He has a very nice picture with George W. Bush. He is against, you know, extreme poverty.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Kimberly Guilfoyle.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I was actually going to say Judge Jeanine. I love her -- everything is like, "Greg Gutfeld!"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh, Greg Gutfeld , you better not leave.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Or it could be Judge Napolitano. It's not in the constitution. It's not in the constitution.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Who else you've got?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I choose some other people, but they aren't here anymore.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Joseph -- I will start...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: We may not have a show by Monday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If you were able to be in one conversation in history, which one would you choose? That's a good one.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: These are hard!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We did this already.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Did we?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, this was last week!

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: You are recycling.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I teased it last week.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Amanda.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Answer it.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I would want to be in the conversation between Frederick Douglass and Abraham Lincoln.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, that's good. That's good. Historical line.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Historic conversation. Pay attention, Kimberly!

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: We did this. I said before Ronald Reagan and Margaret Thatcher.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, because I teased this last week.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: But I answered this last week.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do not challenge the questions of "Facebook Friday."

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I'm challenging it.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: You can't challenge Alex (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I have one.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You have one?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I want to be at the dinner with President Trump and President Xi of China when they are sitting...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Chocolate cake.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: ... with the delicious chocolate cake. I would want some of the chocolate cake. I would give anything to be there when he told the president that we struck Syria.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I guess that is history.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Mother of all bombs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I was going to say the Comey-Trump dinner so we can get to the bottom of that fiasco.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Would you be pretending to be one of the curtains?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Jesse would be writing notes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: With his little porcupine haircut.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would like to be in the conversation (inaudible) when they were hiring me.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What were we thinking?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I just kind of walked in there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: (inaudible) shows up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And then emails that say, why?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: For the longest time, they thought I was Brian Kilmeade.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's why Brian Kilmeade would get in trouble all the time because they thought it was me.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: You know what? They thought it was actually two (ph).

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He actually plays you sometimes here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. We got to go. "One More Thing" up next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Time now for "One More Thing," KG.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. Thank you, Jesse. Take a look at this. An unknown member of the British Royal Air Force wrote a personal message on a missile targeting ISIS after the group claimed responsibility for the Manchester attack. It simply says, love from Manchester. Now, they have confirmed to Fox that the photo is genuine and is quickly going viral. This is to (inaudible) messages. And in a few minutes, if you could please come with me upstairs, I will be hosting "Hannity." Yes, you'll see me in this dress. I got a fantastic line up tonight. Michelle Malkin, Herman Cain, Dinesh D'Souza, Steve Hilton, (inaudible), Joe Concha, Charlie Kirk, a whole bunch of people. It's going to be fantastic. We have a great show.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Keep it locked on Fox. Greg Gutfeld?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tomorrow night, 10:00, Saturday. I hope you're around. It's a great show. I got Joey Jones. I got Matt Iseman. Nigel Farage is going to be on. But here we have the return of.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Greg's prom tips.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I forgot about that. All right, the worst thing about the prom are the prom proposals. It's a stupid attention seeking cliched idiotic thing where people have to make it into a big deal to ask somebody for the prom. Go to the Santa Monica Mountain -- national recreation. I'm sure some guy is walking with his girl, hey, let's go with little rock. Hey, how do you think the rock feels? You know, can't you just ask someone out these days? Do you have to make a big deal out of it? I'm tired of it!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Greg needs a cocktail. All right. So, "Watters World," 8:00, Saturday night. I talked to Eric Trump, business politics, other things. Roll the tape.

utterances.speaker: ERIC TRUMP, BUSINESSMAN, SON OF DONALD TRUMP
utterances.utterance: My family is growing. My wife is expecting in September.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Congratulations. You need a baby name. Jesse is a great name.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Yeah, I like that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Another piece of advice. I have twin girls. My golf games suffered dramatically when you have kids.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Also, Greg and I -- I mean, not Greg and I. Eric and I play golf together and we are going to show you who wins and who loses.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's a Freudian slip.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I know. I really want to play golf with you, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, wouldn't end well.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: For you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Would be in the rock.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Richard?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: The romance isn't all dead. Mark Zuckerberg spoke at Harvard University at the commencement. Here's what he said.

utterances.speaker: MARK ZUCKERBERG, CEO, FACEBOOK
utterances.utterance: Best memory from Harvard is meeting Priscilla. We met in line for the bathroom in the bell tower. In what must be one of the all-time most romantic lines, I turned to her and said, "I'm getting kicked out in three days, so we need to go on a date quickly."

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Clearly, I'm not getting kicked out. I will never go on a day, but at least the romance is still there, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Very happy.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: I believe in good prom proposal.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Always good to know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Lisa Boothe?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: All right. Dave Shuker is a 71-year-old army veteran, and he's now going to receive his high school diploma and finally graduate. He was not able to graduate because during his junior year, he decided to enlist, mostly there was financial problems in his family. That's one of the reasons. He's able to get his diploma because of operation recognition, which helps veterans over 60 years old who are unable to receive their diploma get one. So congratulations to him, and I hope you are celebrating with family and friends. Thank you for your service.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Congratulations, and happy Memorial Day weekend, everybody.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.utterance: Happy Memorial Day weekend.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, you as well, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Make sure to watch us on Monday. Very special Memorial Day show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Unless there is breaking news.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Don't jinx it! Have a great holiday weekend, everybody. K.G. hosts "Hannity," which is up next. Content and Programming Copyright 2017 Fox News Network, LLC.
